summary:
Makes small changes to optimise Breezehome.
Adds some storage and a Arcane Enchanter and removes some spiderwebs etc.
This all without making Breezehome OP in any way
descriptionHtml:
[b]Liked this?, then please endorse[/b]
and help spread the word and let more people have the enjoyment of using this mod ;D

[quote=Moar Mods:]Enjoyed using Optimised Breezehome?
Why not give GentleManor a shot?:
[url=file.php?id=9949]GentleManor[/url]

GentleManor is a mod that creates a thief type home (usable for any play style) with lots of storage and very nifty features.[/quote]

[u]Description[/u]

This is a mod changing a few minor things in Breezehome.
These things I found out to be annoying or lacking in the original and decided to add by console, however I liked it so much I made it into a mod.

[b]It changes:[/b]

It adds more storage
- 1 Chest
- 1 Cupboard
- 1 Strongbox
- 1 Safe
- 1 Arcane Enchanter
- 1 Enchanter\'s Satchel
- 1 Chair (in front of the arcane enchanter)

[b]2.0:[/b]
Version 2 of Optimised Breezehome adds more storage and fixes somethings.
It changes Breezehome a bit more, if you do not like more change in Breezehome, then use version 1.0

- 2 Barrels
- 3 Shield Plaques
- 1 Weapons Plaque
- 2 Satchels
- 9 Shrines of the Nine Divines (Talos included)

- Moved the Stairs to stop the shin breaking (what was up with the stairs Bethesda? :S)
- Replaced lots of stuff with their Noble counterpart
  This without disturbing the atmosphere of Breezehome
- Lydia will no longer be perma residing in you room (no moar endless chair sitting...., for Lydia)

It removes all uggly looking spiderwebs etc.


I made this mod after playing Skyrim (a lot) and using Breezehome a lot to.
I realised pretty soon that Breezehome is worth the money but just lacks a few storage containers (for sorting) and has some uggly spiderwebs etc. in areas they don\'t belong.
This is however my first mod (won\'t be the last) so any critism or bugs found are always welcome and will be looked at.

(I checked the storage for respawning/item removal)

as with all home mods, all upgrades for the concerning home are needed before installing

[u]Updates:[/u]

[b]2.02[/b]

Fixed the Weapon Plagque under the stairs

[B]2.01[/b]

This update adds:

- a Shrine of Nocturnal

This update fixes:

- the Shrines
- the Weapon plaque

[b]2.0[/b]

[b][u]Before Updating:[/u][/b]
Make sure to empty:

- The Safe
- The Satchels
- The Nightstands (next to the bed)
- The Dresser
- The 2 Cupboards
This because I changed their IDs to stop them from intevering with Vanilla Skyrim items / objects.


Added:

- 2 Barrels
- 3 Shield Plaques
- 1 Weapons Plaque
- 2 Satchels
- 9 Shrines of the Nine Divines (Talos included)

- Moved the Stairs to stop the shin breaking (what was up with the stairs Bethesda? :S)
- Replaced lots of stuff with their Noble counterpart
  This without disturbing the atmosphere of Breezehome
- Lydia no longer stuck in bedroom
- This mod no longer influences Vanilla Skyrim items / objects
author: BannerFigurezZz
